title: Authors and Citation
text: Alexandre Bohyn. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bohyn (2026). lbstproj: Tools Create Use Standardized R Projects L-Biostat Group. R package version 0.1.0, https://l-biostat.github.io/lbstproj/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {lbstproj: Tools To Create And Use Standardized R Projects For The L-Biostat Group},   author = {Alexandre Bohyn},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://l-biostat.github.io/lbstproj/}, }

what: Tools To Create And Use Standardized R Projects For The L-Biostat Group
title: Tools To Create And Use Standardized R Projects For The L-Biostat Group
text: lbstproj provides tools create, maintain, use standardized R projects L-Biostat group.

title: Tools To Create And Use Standardized R Projects For The L-Biostat Group
text: can install development version lbstproj GitHub :
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("L-Biostat/lbstproj")

title: Tools To Create And Use Standardized R Projects For The L-Biostat Group
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(lbstproj) ## basic example code

what: Build a report file name with date, version, and optional counter and ext — build_report_name
title: Build a report file name with date, version, and optional counter and ext — build_report_name
text: Build report file name date, version, optional counter ext

title: Build a report file name with date, version, and optional counter and ext — build_report_name
code: build_report_name(extension, counter = NULL)

title: Build a report file name with date, version, and optional counter and ext — build_report_name
text: extension file extension report (e.g., "html", "pdf"). counter optional counter append file name uniqueness. NULL, counter added.

what: Standardized way to create a Rmd code chunk to insert a figure or a table — create_chunk
title: Standardized way to create a Rmd code chunk to insert a figure or a table — create_chunk
text: Standardized way create Rmd code chunk insert figure table

title: Standardized way to create a Rmd code chunk to insert a figure or a table — create_chunk
code: create_chunk(id, type, copy = TRUE, print = TRUE, pad = FALSE)

title: Standardized way to create a Rmd code chunk to insert a figure or a table — create_chunk
text: id id figure specified table tables (TOT) type type entry, either "figure" "table" copy Logical, whether copy chunk clipboard (default: TRUE interactive mode) print Logical, whether print chunk console (default: TRUE) pad Logical, whether pad chunk blank lines pagebreak (default: FALSE)

title: Standardized way to create a Rmd code chunk to insert a figure or a table — create_chunk
text: rendered Rmd chunk character string, invisibly

what: Create a DESCRIPTION file for the project — create_description
title: Create a DESCRIPTION file for the project — create_description
text: create_description() creates DESCRIPTION file project, using project root directory "package name" adding fields: Title, Author, Client, Department. function check arguments validity. assumes checked create_project() function.

title: Create a DESCRIPTION file for the project — create_description
code: create_description(title, client, department, author, version, quiet = FALSE)

what: Create a Rmd code chunk to insert a figure — create_figure_chunk
title: Create a Rmd code chunk to insert a figure — create_figure_chunk
text: Create Rmd code chunk insert figure

title: Create a Rmd code chunk to insert a figure — create_figure_chunk
code: create_figure_chunk(id, copy = TRUE, print = TRUE, pad = FALSE)

title: Create a Rmd code chunk to insert a figure — create_figure_chunk
text: id id figure specified table tables (TOT) copy Logical, whether copy chunk clipboard (default: TRUE interactive mode) print Logical, whether print chunk console (default: TRUE) pad Logical, whether pad chunk blank lines pagebreak (default: FALSE)

what: Internal function to create a R-script file from a template based on type — create_file
title: Internal function to create a R-script file from a template based on type — create_file
text: Internal function create R-script file template based type

title: Internal function to create a R-script file from a template based on type — create_file
code: create_file(type, name, open, print = NULL, ...)

what: Create all R scripts listed in the table of tables (TOT) — create_programs
title: Create all R scripts listed in the table of tables (TOT) — create_programs
text: function loads TOT creates R scripts figures tables listed respective directories R folder. existing scripts names overwritten.

title: Create all R scripts listed in the table of tables (TOT) — create_programs
code: create_programs()

title: Create a New Project — create_project
text: create_project() initializes new project standardized structure specified path. prompts user essential metadata provided. function creates necessary directories, DESCRIPTION file, table tables (TOT) Excel file. project successfully created, opens new project RStudio.

title: Create a New Project — create_project
code: create_project(   path = ".",   title = NULL,   client = NULL,   department = NULL,   author = NULL,   version = "1.0.0",   open = rlang::is_interactive(),   force = FALSE,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Create a New Project — create_project
text: path Path project created (default current directory). title Title project. client Name client. department Department code name. author Author name (first last). version Project version (default 1.0.0). open TRUE, opens new project RStudio (default TRUE interactive session). force TRUE, skips confirmation prompt creating project (default FALSE). quiet TRUE, suppresses informational messages project creation (default FALSE).

title: Create a New Project — create_project
text: Invisibly returns active project path.

title: Create a New Project — create_project
text: following directory structure created inside project:
code: ├── data │   ├── figures │   ├── processed │   ├── raw │   ├── tables │   └── tot ├── docs │   └── meetings ├── results │   ├── figures │   ├── tables │   └── reports ├── R │   ├── data │   ├── figures │   └── tables └── report     └── utils

title: Create a New Project — create_project
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ create_project(   path = ".", # uses current directory   title = "Example Project",   client = "Client Name",   department = "DEP",   author = "Jane Doe",   version = "0.1.0" ) } # }

what: Create a Rmd report based on the table of tables (TOT) — create_report
title: Create a Rmd report based on the table of tables (TOT) — create_report
text: Create Rmd report based table tables (TOT)

title: Create a Rmd report based on the table of tables (TOT) — create_report
code: create_report(overwrite = TRUE)

what: Create a R script pre-filled with boilerplate code — create_scripts
title: Create a R script pre-filled with boilerplate code — create_scripts
text: family helpers write minimal R script project subfolder R/: figures, tables, functions, data.

title: Create a R script pre-filled with boilerplate code — create_scripts
code: create_figure(name, overwrite = FALSE, open = rlang::is_interactive(), ...)  create_table(name, overwrite = FALSE, open = rlang::is_interactive(), ...)  create_function(name, overwrite = FALSE, open = rlang::is_interactive())  create_data(name, overwrite = FALSE, open = rlang::is_interactive())  create_model(name, overwrite = FALSE, open = rlang::is_interactive())

title: Create a R script pre-filled with boilerplate code — create_scripts
text: name Name script (without file extension). overwrite Whether overwrite existing file name. Defaults FALSE. open Whether open new file editor. Defaults TRUE interactive session (.e. RStudio IDEs). ... Additional arguments passed template rendering function. See details. print Whether print (default: TRUE) success message console. can set default print behavior functions family setting global option use.print TRUE FALSE.

title: Create a R script pre-filled with boilerplate code — create_scripts
text: functions called side effects: create new script, make parent directories needed, (optionally) open file. return value. creating new table new figure script, can pass additional argument id. used retrieve caption label information table tables project. allow dynamic changes captions labels single place (.e. table tables).

title: Create a R script pre-filled with boilerplate code — create_scripts
text: create_figure(): Create figure script R/figures/. create_table(): Create table script R/tables/. create_function(): Create function script R/functions/. create_data(): Create data script R/data/. create_model(): Create model script R/models/.

title: Create a R script pre-filled with boilerplate code — create_scripts
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ create_figure("eda_hist01", overwrite = FALSE) create_table("summary_endpoints", open = FALSE) create_function("strings_utils") } # }

what: Create the standard project structure — create_structure
title: Create the standard project structure — create_structure
text: create_structure() creates standard folder structure project. folders already exist skipped.

title: Create the standard project structure — create_structure
code: create_structure(quiet = FALSE)

what: Create a Rmd code chunk to insert a table — create_table_chunk
title: Create a Rmd code chunk to insert a table — create_table_chunk
text: Create Rmd code chunk insert table

title: Create a Rmd code chunk to insert a table — create_table_chunk
code: create_table_chunk(id, copy = TRUE, print = TRUE, pad = FALSE)

title: Create a Rmd code chunk to insert a table — create_table_chunk
text: id id figure specified table tables (TOT) copy Logical, whether copy chunk clipboard (default: TRUE interactive mode) print Logical, whether print chunk console (default: TRUE) pad Logical, whether pad chunk blank lines pagebreak (default: FALSE)

what: Create a Empty Table of Tables (TOT) Excel file in the project — create_tot
title: Create a Empty Table of Tables (TOT) Excel file in the project — create_tot
text: create_tot() copies template TOT Excel file lbstproj package data/tot/ directory project. example TOT file contains example row guidance. deleted use.

title: Create a Empty Table of Tables (TOT) Excel file in the project — create_tot
code: create_tot(quiet = FALSE)

title: Create a Empty Table of Tables (TOT) Excel file in the project — create_tot
text: "data/tot/" directory exist, created. TOT file already exists target directory, overwritten.

what: Export a figure to results/figures/ — export_figure
title: Export a figure to results/figures/ — export_figure
text: Save publication-ready figure results/figures/<name>.<ext> using ggplot2::ggsave(). parent directory created needed existing file overwritten unless overwrite = TRUE.

title: Export a figure to results/figures/ — export_figure
code: export_figure(   fig,   name,   ext = "png",   print = NULL,   width = 8,   height = 6,   overwrite = TRUE,   ... )

title: Export a figure to results/figures/ — export_figure
text: fig ggplot2::ggplot object. name Name used save figure (without file extension). ext Output format/extension. One "png", "pdf", "jpeg", "tiff", "bmp", "svg". Defaults "png". (Raster: png/jpeg/tiff/bmp; Vector: pdf/svg.) print Whether print (default: TRUE) success message console. can set default print behavior functions family setting global option export.print TRUE FALSE. width, height Plot dimensions passed ggplot2::ggsave() (inches default; can pass units = "cm" units = "mm" via ...). overwrite Whether overwrite existing file name. Defaults FALSE. ... Additional arguments forwarded ggplot2::ggsave() (e.g., dpi, units, bg, device).

title: Export a figure to results/figures/ — export_figure
text: function called side effects return value.

title: Export a figure to results/figures/ — export_figure
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) + geom_point() export_figure(p, name = "scatter_mpg_wt", ext = "pdf", width = 7, height = 5) export_figure(p, name = "scatter_png", dpi = 300)  # defaults to PNG } # }

what: Export a table to results/tables/ — export_table
title: Export a table to results/tables/ — export_table
text: Save formatted table results/tables/<name>.<ext>. Supports gt tables via gt::gtsave() flextable via corresponding save_as_*() helpers. parent directory created needed existing file overwritten unless overwrite = TRUE.

title: Export a table to results/tables/ — export_table
code: export_table(   tbl,   name,   ext,   print = NULL,   overwrite = TRUE,   landscape = FALSE,   ... )

title: Export a table to results/tables/ — export_table
text: tbl gt::gt() table (gt_tbl) flextable::flextable() object. name Name used save table (without file extension). ext Output format/extension. One "docx", "pdf", "html", "rtf". print Whether print (default: TRUE) success message console. can set default print behavior functions family setting global option export.print TRUE FALSE. overwrite Whether overwrite existing file name. Defaults FALSE. landscape Logical; flextable exports , set page orientation landscape. Ignored gt tables. ... Additional arguments forwarded gt::gtsave() (gt) relevant flextable::save_as_*() function (flextable).

title: Export a table to results/tables/ — export_table
text: function called side effects return value.

title: Export a table to results/tables/ — export_table
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(gt) gt_tbl <- head(mtcars) |> gt() export_table(gt_tbl, name = "mtcars_head", ext = "html")  library(flextable) ft <- flextable(head(iris)) export_table(ft, name = "iris_doc", ext = "docx", landscape = TRUE) } # }

what: Get Information About an Item by ID — get_info
title: Get Information About an Item by ID — get_info
text: Retrieve information item table tables (TOT) based ID.

title: Get Information About an Item by ID — get_info
code: get_info(id)

title: Get Information About an Item by ID — get_info
text: id positive integer representing unique identifier item. Must supplied, else function throw error.

title: Get Information About an Item by ID — get_info
text: list containing columns TOT specified ID. columns (order): id, type, name, caption

title: Get Information About an Item by ID — get_info
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  info <- get_info(1)  print(info$caption) # Access the caption of the item } # }

what: Import the Table of Tables (TOT) — import_tot
title: Import the Table of Tables (TOT) — import_tot
text: Reads TOT Excel file data/tot/table_of_tables.xlsx, validates structure, saves RDS file data/tot/tot.rds.

title: Import the Table of Tables (TOT) — import_tot
code: import_tot(quiet = FALSE)

title: Import the Table of Tables (TOT) — import_tot
text: Invisibly returns TOT data tibble.

what: Global options for the lbstproj package — lbstproj-options
title: Global options for the lbstproj package — lbstproj-options
text: Global options lbstproj package

title: Global options for the lbstproj package — lbstproj-options
text: options(save.print = TRUE) (default): print messages saving figures tables. options(export.print = TRUE) (default): print messages exporting figures tables. options(use.print = TRUE) (default): print messages creating new R script.

what: lbstproj: Tools To Create And Use Standardized R Projects For The L-Biostat Group — lbstproj-package
title: lbstproj: Tools To Create And Use Standardized R Projects For The L-Biostat Group — lbstproj-package
text: package provides functions easily start new statistical analysis project R. creates standardized folder structure files, allow easier collaboration reproducible research. also provides functions easily load preprocess data, generate export figures tables, create reports various formats.

title: lbstproj: Tools To Create And Use Standardized R Projects For The L-Biostat Group — lbstproj-package
text: Maintainer: Alexandre Bohyn alexandre.bohyn@kuleuven.(ORCID)

what: Load functions from the R/functions directory — load_func
title: Load functions from the R/functions directory — load_func
text: helper functions load one functions R/functions directory.

title: Load functions from the R/functions directory — load_func
code: load_all_functions()  load_function(name)

title: Load functions from the R/functions directory — load_func
text: name name specific function file load. must relative R/functions directory can include omit .R extension.

title: Load functions from the R/functions directory — load_func
text: load_all_functions(): Load functions files. load_function(): Load single function file.

title: Load functions from the R/functions directory — load_func
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ load_all_functions() load_function("data_cleaning") # Works load_function("data_cleaning.R") # Also works load_function("R/functions/data_cleaning.R") # Fails } # }

what: Load the Table of Tables (TOT) — load_tot
title: Load the Table of Tables (TOT) — load_tot
text: Simple wrapper function load TOT RDS file.

title: Load the Table of Tables (TOT) — load_tot
code: load_tot(refresh = TRUE)

title: Load the Table of Tables (TOT) — load_tot
text: refresh Logical; TRUE, re-imports TOT Excel file using import_tot(). Default TRUE TOT may updated frequently.

title: Load the Table of Tables (TOT) — load_tot
text: tibble containing TOT data following columns: id: Unique identifier item. type: Type item (either "table" "figure"). name: Name item. caption: Caption item.

title: Load the Table of Tables (TOT) — load_tot
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  tot <- load_tot() } # }

what: Moves a report to a different location and rename it uniquely — move_rename_report
title: Moves a report to a different location and rename it uniquely — move_rename_report
text: Move report file generated run_report() reports/ directory results/reports/ directory, renaming include: current date project version (DESCRIPTION file) unique identifier file name already exists function helps archive reports systematically.

title: Moves a report to a different location and rename it uniquely — move_rename_report
code: move_rename_report(old_path, overwrite = FALSE)

title: Moves a report to a different location and rename it uniquely — move_rename_report
text: old_path current path report file moved (extension filename) overwrite Logical; TRUE, overwrite existing report files results/reports/ directory. FALSE, unique name generated avoid overwriting, appending counter filename (e.g. _001, _002, etc.). Default FALSE.

title: Moves a report to a different location and rename it uniquely — move_rename_report
text: path moved renamed report file.

title: Run All R Scripts — run_all
text: Run R scripts directory R folder. functions run_all_figures() run_all_tables() wrappers around general run_all() function run R scripts R/figures R/tables directories, respectively. two cases, function checks discrepancies files directory table tables (ToT) running scripts throws warning found.

title: Run All R Scripts — run_all
code: run_all(dir, skip = NULL)  run_all_figures(skip = NULL)  run_all_tables(skip = NULL)

title: Run All R Scripts — run_all
text: dir Character. directory run scripts . Must existing directory R folder project. example, "figures" run scripts R/figures. skip Optional integer. Number scripts skip start. Default NULL meaning scripts run.

title: Run All R Scripts — run_all
text: R scripts found matching *.R respective directory. Therefore, file ending .r (techically valid recommended) ignored.

title: Run All R Scripts — run_all
text: run_all_figures(): run R scripts R/figures run_all_tables(): run R scripts R/tables

title: Run All R Scripts — run_all
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ run_all("figures") run_all_figures() # equivalent to previous run_all("data") run_all("directory-that-does-not-exist") # throws an error run_all_tables(skip = 3) # starts from the 4th script } # }

title: Render the report — run_report
text: Render Rmd report located report/report.Rmd report/ directory. Also move rename generated report results/reports/ directory.

title: Render the report — run_report
code: run_report(overwrite = FALSE)

title: Render the report — run_report
text: overwrite Logical; TRUE, overwrite existing report files results/reports/ directory. FALSE, unique name generated avoid overwriting, appending counter filename (e.g. _001, _002, etc.). Default FALSE.

title: Render the report — run_report
text: path moved renamed report file, invisibly.

what: Internal function to save an R object to the appropriate directory — save_object
title: Internal function to save an R object to the appropriate directory — save_object
text: Internal function save R object appropriate directory

title: Internal function to save an R object to the appropriate directory — save_object
code: save_object(type, object, name, overwrite, print = NULL, ...)

title: Save analysis objects as .rds — save_scripts
text: family helpers save figures, tables, data sets .rds files via base::saveRDS(). function writes designated output directory.

title: Save analysis objects as .rds — save_scripts
code: save_data(object, name, overwrite = TRUE, print = NULL, ...)  save_figure(object, name, overwrite = TRUE, print = NULL, ...)  save_table(object, name, overwrite = TRUE, print = NULL, ...)

title: Save analysis objects as .rds — save_scripts
text: object object save (figure/table/data). R object supported base::saveRDS(). name Name used save object (without file extension). overwrite Whether overwrite existing file name. Defaults FALSE. print Whether print (default: TRUE) success message console. can set default print behavior functions family setting global option save.print TRUE FALSE. ... Additional arguments passed base::saveRDS() (e.g., compress, version).

title: Save analysis objects as .rds — save_scripts
text: helpers called side effects return value.

title: Save analysis objects as .rds — save_scripts
text: save_data(): Save data object data/processed/. save_figure(): Save figure data/figures/. save_table(): Save table data/tables/.

title: Save analysis objects as .rds — save_scripts
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Figures save_figure(plot, "main_effect", compress = "xz")  # Tables save_table(tbl, "baseline_summary")  # Data (saved to data/processed/) save_data(df, "patients_clean", version = 3) } # }
